website_summaries.verdict: Minor quirks aside, these Red Wings are made for men who want more than a shoe but a pair that's shorter in the ankle than traditional boots.
pros: A must-have for men who want casual boots that look good and are less bulky than typical styles, as the chukka design is fairly lightweight and easy to wear
Also ideal for work wear, as the durable soles are perfect for men who are on their feet all day
cons: While most Red Wings run large, the slightly narrow toe may make these fit a bit tightly for some wearers
Break-in period could take a few weeks, as the leather is still at first

customer_reviews.title: winter boots and by seasons end the boots looked like a couple of years old
customer_reviews.text: I can agree, you get what you pay for. Every year I would spend about 150 for fall, winter boots and by seasons end the boots looked like a couple of years old. A friend of mine has been boasting about Red Wings and his seem to be holding up great, will see. One thing I can say is the scent that you get when you open the box for the first time smells like a New baseball glove .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Careful - Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I love Redwings. Over the past 10 years, I have purchased 3 pairs of Redwing work boots and I love them. So, I thought to purchase these Chukkas. I ordered the same size (size 9) as my other 3 pairs. However, they were way too small — not even close. So, I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce H

customer_reviews.title: Won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: As fine as chukka boot as you'll find. Some break in, yes; but not excessive. Give yourself about three days and they'll fit like a glove. Handsome; but, you don't have to baby them either. They can take it. True to size, for me anyway. Wish I'd got them twenty years ago. They'll outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: wyoschrods

customer_reviews.title: I like the shoes but have to return because i orded ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes but have to return because i orded it 1/2 size down like i would on the Iron Rangers. They are a little pointy at the toes and thus a bit narrow. Construction is top notch and is quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Le Carpentry LLC

customer_reviews.title: USA made and USA quality - Treat yourself!
customer_reviews.text: Redwing boots are not for the light weight or light wallet person if you enjoy new shoes every few months. These boots, on the other hand last years. I find you do you get what you pay for and Redwing shoes are a quality item. I also own a pair of Redwing Heritage Iron Ranger boots which are holding up extremely well after over three years of daily wear and tear. Extremely comfortable and durable. Also lifetime free replacement laces from local Redwing shoe store.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for me but they were to small. Luckily my uncle uses size 10 and it fit him perfectly! Beautiful boots and color.
customer_reviews.author: Lugarking

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. The shoes have clearly been worn. There are creases in the leather and wearing on the soles. Each shoe also had tears on the tips. Will not be buying these expensive shoes online again
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Gardilcic

customer_reviews.title: Dont hesitate BUY them!
customer_reviews.text: I had been on the fence wanting to order these Red Wing shoes for almost a year. Why did I wait that long?! Wearing them for the first day was the worst, raising a small blister on my heel. but by the 3rd day they are like old friends. They look great obviously with blue jeans, yet would look dressy enough for chinos or slacks. Owning & operating a retail hardware store I am on my feet 10-12 hours a day so good shoes are very important. These fill the bill! I am seriously considering buying a second pair in fears Red Wing may change the fit-style or just discontinue them
customer_reviews.author: James L Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and first class craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this from Amazon and been wearing it everyday for almost a week. Took a couple of days to break it in. It was very stiff at first but became very comfortable to use at work. I work as a security professional and I spend my typical day on my feet for at least 7 hours. Glad I decided to order this because my feet are no longer sore after my shift. I normally wear size 7 1/2, ordered size 7 and it fits perfectly. Highly recommend this chukka from Red Wings. It has a very simple look just like my pair of Iron Rangers. Can't go wrong wing Red Wings.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Carpio

customer_reviews.title: Wonder ir a 12 is better fit.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, hard insole, narow at the front. Tight. May be true to Size. I am a true 12 and order 11.5. Wonder ir a 12 is better fit.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Cruel shoes
customer_reviews.text: Expected a great shoe after break-in period but after two months shoes are stiff and hurts to walk. Also a very heavy shoe. I won't bring them on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Hwy114

customer_reviews.title: Fit was fine.....but,
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that there was no cushioned inner sole at this price. Bought a Worksole Innersole and they are now very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They’ll last longer than you!
customer_reviews.text: Top quality shoe. Made in the good ol’ US of A. Wears like iron. Ordered a half size DOWN. Once broken in, very comfortable. Great support and just dang good looking. Only negative, not good on snow or ice, sole and heal smooth. Just buy a pair of RW Roughneck’s for winter and call it a day🍸
customer_reviews.author: FubarSir

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: As for me, this is robust, well made boots. My foot is 26,7 cm. I ordered 8,5 M it is more the less good. My ECCO shoes size 41 euro.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim Zemlyakov

product_meta.title: Red Wing Heritage Men's Foreman Chukka Lace Up
product_meta.description:
Red Wing Heritage's Foreman Chukkas combine a simple leather boot upper and Red Wing's durable neoprene cushion sole. The Foreman Chukka is a lightweight shoe that takes the timeless chukka design and attaches it to a comfortable neoprene work sole. The neoprene outsole was designed to provide traction and long-wearing support for workers who spend hours on their feet and move between various terrain. The combination created the Foreman Chukka, a shoe designed to work and relax both outdoors and indoors while standing up to any environment.

For almost a century, Red Wing Shoes has been producing top-quality work boots and shoes. It started with a corner store in the quiet river town of Red Wing, Minn. Today, Red Wing Shoes produces thousands of handmade shoes every day, making their legendary quality available worldwide. A true American success story, Red Wing Shoes provided footwear for the U.S. Military in both World Wars. Norman Rockwell created artwork for the company during the 1960s. And in the new global economy, Red Wing Shoes continues to evolve to meet the needs of a new generation, with more than 150 styles perfect for work or play. Red Wing Shoes is legendary for producing tough, durable footwear that can handle any challenge. Their shoes and boots are created with four principles in mind: quality, durability, comfort, and craftsmanship. Each is given a hand inspection before being sent out the door, to ensure that it meets Red Wing Shoes' exacting standards. And the quality of their footwear is guaranteed. So look to Red Wing Shoes first for footwear that lasts.Hardware:Bronze Eyelets
feature_bullets: Handcrafted in the united states of america with durable stitch-down welt construction
